intro: Loasa elongata, commonly known as the elongated loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Loasa elongata is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
